required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence of Lower Urinary Tract Symptoms in Women With Gynecologic Malignancy Planning to Undergo Surgical Management
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of Lower Urinary Tract Symptoms in Women With Gynecologic Malignancy Planning to Undergo Surgical Management

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to determine the prevalence of lower urinary tract symptoms in women undergoing surgery for gynecologic malignancy.

detailed_description.textblock: Lower urinary tract symptoms, including urinary incontinence, voiding dysfunction, urgency, frequency, fecal incontinence, as well as sexual dysfunction, is directly affected by gynecologic malignancies and the surgical and medical management of those malignancies. Increased risk of injury to the urinary tract is a recognized complication of surgical and medical therapy of gynecologic malignancies. To date, only a few studies have looked at the incidence of lower urinary tract symptoms at the time of diagnosis of gynecologic malignancy and prior to treatment, and there have been no published studies describing the incidence of sexual dysfunction at the time of diagnosis and prior to therapy of gynecologic malignancies. However, sexual dysfunction has been described in patients with urinary incontinence and pelvic organ prolapse and following surgery for incontinence and pelvic organ prolapse.

primary_outcome.measure: The outcome will be measured using validated general and condition-specific questionnaires.

study_pop.textblock: Have a diagnosis of a gynecologic malignancy: cervical, endometrial, or ovarian cancer, and plan to have surgry for the cancer treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with a new diagnosis of gynecologic malignancy who plan to undergo surgical management, including cervical, endometrial, and ovarian cancer.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects less than 18 years of age
- Subjects unable to give informed consent

facility.name: University of California, Irvine Medical Center

responsible_party.organization: University of California, Irvine Medical Center
